ThingDef.label: Inspector Horse: Bloody Spires
ThingDef.Description: A crime-fiction series about a grizzled detective and her case files. In this episode she gets involved in Hive politics.

BookText.li: It was an ordinary evening on spire XIV
when the Ordinate-major received a cryptic message
asking him to come to an oddly specific street corner.
with a sense of foreboding, he went out into the night
As his eyes accustomed to the overbearing darkness
of the forsaken alley in the middle of "new oldtown"
he spotted HER standing there, silent, like a statue
as he moved in closer for their customary embrace
he noted her eyes were closed and her mouth wide open
From her left hand something was dripping to the floor.

ThingDef.label: Revenga
ThingDef.Description: The story of a man who lost everything.

BookText.li: They beat him senseless
they burned down his house
they shot him in the chest
they left him for dead.
Now he's back.
And this time, he's packing.

ThingDef.label: Fafnar's Fairytales
ThingDef.Description: A collection of amusing stories originating from primitive worlds. Deemed harmless by the Inquisition.

BookText.li: There once was a man who lived in a hole
he tried to live life like a carrot
So his skin turned orange and his hair green
Until finally he couldn't leave the hole
Summer cometh and his hair sported flowers
then autumn came and his hair turned golden
then winter came and he turned bald
spring came and birds nested on his head
and all the while the man was smiling
And he lived as a carrot head happily ever after.

ThingDef.label: Sergius' Guide to the Fringe
ThingDef.Description: A humorous handbook for frequent travellers between planets.

BookText.li: Rule Nr. 1: There are no safe havens.
Rule Nr. 2: If cooked long enough, any meat tastes the same.
Rule Nr. 3: Don't grow too attached to anything, especially your comrades.
Rule Nr. 4: Trade is your friend. The trader himself is not.
Rule Nr. 5: If it can bite you, eventually it will, no matter the species.
Rule Nr. 6: If it's not on someone's body, it's yours.
Rule Nr. 7: If it's on a dead body, it's yours.
Rule Nr. 8: If unsure whether it's your, still take it.
Rule Nr. 9: Mexican Standoffs can yield lasting friendships.
Rule Nr. 10: Trust is overrated. As is personal hygiene.

ThingDef.label: Atlas of the Fringe
ThingDef.Description: A collection of pictographs of some of the most beautiful places in nearby systems.

BookText.li: A volcanic erruption
A flock of exotic birds
A giant waterfall
Thermal springs
A herd of gracile quadrupeds
Three overlapping full moons
A colorful fiest of some natives
A rocky field full of steaming geysirs

ThingDef.label: Bernard's History of Fashion
ThingDef.Description: A work depicting the evolution of different clothing styles among several inhabited planets in the same sector.

BookText.li: Weird looking apparel on even weirder looking models
A swirly beige neglegee worn over a coat made of muffalo tails.
A long purple dress adorned with white arctic wolf tails.
A hat made of a stuffed boomrat-bubble.
A brown waiscloth made from alpaca fur.
A grey vest made from a gorilla chest.
A woven blueish longcoat of muffalo wool.

ThingDef.label: Healthcare on the Rim
ThingDef.Description: A work by famous wandering healer Eve who travelled rimworlds of the Imperium for over 80 years.

BookText.li: Being a doctor on a rimworld
is like most diseases you'll encounter:
It can kill you.
You'll face the elements
You'll operate under fire and power-shortage
You'll do labwork during earthquakes
You'll fight superstition more often than maladies
You'll be a paragon and a pariah.
Mind these things before walking this path.
Chapter One: Theoretical Background

ThingDef.label: Eko's Scientific Studies
ThingDef.Description: A work by an intellectual called Eko about the spirit of exploration and how to properly document it.

BookText.li: Research is far from dead.
Research without caution is dangerous.
If you did not document it, it didn't happen.
Think before you act.
Show respect: Do NOT plagiarize.
Do not fret over fame or fortune.
Ask questions, then evaluate the answers.
Consider your readers.
Look for failure. Do not tread failed paths.
If it looks easy, it probably isn't.

ThingDef.label: Nefton: Basics of Science
ThingDef.Description: Written by a tech-adept for the Scola Progenium as an introduction to basic physics, chemistry and biology.

BookText.li: Chapter I: Introduction to Science.
Chapter II: Of matter and energy.
Chapter III: Entropy and Enthalpie
Chapter IV: Forces and Mechanics
Chapter V: Basic Chemistry
Chapter VI: Advanced Chemistry
Chapter VII: Basic Biology
Chapter VIII: Advanced Biology

ThingDef.label: Speeches of Kikero
ThingDef.Description: A really old book detailling the rhetoric skill of a renowned lawyer from the ancient times of human civilization.

BookText.li: How blessed are you, my Rome, to be reborn under me.
A room without a book is like a body without a soul
Silence is one of the great arts of communication.
Gratitude is like
Nothing is more unreliable than the populace
Nothing is more obscure than human intentions
O tempora o mores!
Only an idiot persists in his error
The higher we are placed, the humbler we should walk.
Nothing is as harmful as expectations.
To be ignorant of history is to be ever a child.

ThingDef.label: Olivie's 1000 dishes
ThingDef.Description: A book by a traveling chef that has been personal cook to both imperial governors of hive worlds and tribal chieftains on primitive planets. His personal motto is: If it contains carbon, I can make a meal out of it.

BookText.li: This is a cookbook.
An average chef is a good cook.
A good chef is a manager and a good cook.
A great chef is a manager, scientist and a cook.
Produce is precious. Waste is sacrilege.
Taste and health benefits do not correlate!
Chemsynth-sugar tastes stronger than beetroot
Still beetroot is the better option.
Shop local, or plant your own crop.
Feeding a trillion people is different from feeding 10.

ThingDef.label: Gregoriav's Basic Medicine Vol I
ThingDef.Description: A standard piece of literature for anyone attending a medical school in this sector.

BookText.li: Chapter One: Biochemical Foundations
Chapter Two: Cell Biology
Chapter Three: Genetics
Chapter Four: Microbiology and Virology
Chapter Five: Human Anatomy
Chapter Six: Human Physiology
Chapter Seven: Human Metabolism
Chapter Eight: Immunology
Chapter Nine: Endocrinology
Chapter Ten: Oncology

ThingDef.label: Gregoriav's Basic Medicine Vol II
ThingDef.Description: A standard piece of literature for anyone attending a medical school in this sector.

BookText.li: Chapter One: Diagnostics
Chapter Two: Disease Vectors
Chapter Three: Local Treatment
Chapter Four: Systemic Treatment
Chapter Five: Basic Surgery
Chapter Six: Advanced Surgery
Chapter Seven: Mental Health
Chapter Eight: Psychiatric Treatment
Chapter Nine: Pediatric Treatment
Chapter Ten: Veterinary Aspects

ThingDef.label: Alien beasts and how to treat them
ThingDef.Description: A book detailing how to find animal-like lifeforms on different planets and what general patterns of behaviour you may expect from them.

BookText.li: The Globbian Goat is allergic to raisins...
The Ahlphakian Ibex recognizes over 500 distinct shouts...
The Liflian Cow can only be herded by using a shrill voice...
Do not sneeze in front of a Rhegian Rabbit...
Trust and Respect have to be earned, even among animals...
Do not overfeed Hrotzian sheep...
Be patient.
Timberwolves do generally enjoy tummyrubs...
Don't tummyrub sleeping animals that have sharp teeth...
You CAN look to Boomalopes for fuel. Doesn't mean you SHOULD.

ThingDef.label: Storm of Love
ThingDef.Description: The gripping story of a young nobleman who finds his true love in an unexpected place.

BookText.li: The count looked up as a figure entered his dormitory.
Long, lushous hair flowed down her head like a waterfall.
His heart briefly stopped as he realized it was HER.
"Sleep eludes you as well" her voice echoed in the chamber.
"I may not even see the next morning" he said, his eyes glistening.
"Then I'll stay with you, so we may see the sun rise together." she whispered.
"I don't deserve your company" he sighed, looking away into a dark corner.
"Never was someone more deserving than you" she replied earnestly.
A sudden breeze flicked out the candles as their lips gravitated towards each other.

ThingDef.label: Tome of Lightning
ThingDef.Description: A strange book detailing the way energy is created from apparent nothingness.

BookText.li: Your anger is a mist.
Feel it engulfing you, its embrace so familiar.
Open your mind as if opening your arms.
Feel the anger flow like a stream through your fingers.
Pull the stream slowly towards you.
Condense the mist until your holding it like a ball.
Feel it pulsating slowly, like a living thing.
Feel it pushing its boundaries, yearning to expand.
Give into its wishes, and open your mind.
Let go...

ThingDef.label: Tome of Hellfifre
ThingDef.Description: A strange book probably written by a Pyromaniac.

BookText.li: Everything can burn...
If it doesn't burn, you haven't lit it properly...
Fire is cleansing, fire is pure...
The old must make way for the new...
By fire everything shall be renewed.
The renewal only needs one spark: you...
Don't you feel it, everything WANTS to be in flames...
Everything shall be in flames...
Feel it burning down your throat...
Nothing but ashes shall remain...

ThingDef.label: The Veil
ThingDef.Description: A prosaic book full of ill-sounding, yet intriguing verses.

BookText.li: Close your eyes, so you can see
But don't expect to see what's never been there
The veil, it is hidden in plain sight
Step forward, by stepping aside
Push aside whatever you find
Don't push back, let flow into nothingness
A whisper may do, what force cannot.
Open your eyes beyond the veil
Stay for a while, but remember whence you came
The veil will close for you tonight

ThingDef.label: Tome of Isha
ThingDef.Description: A piece of literature that seems to be centered around a being called Isha. It seems to radiate warmth and an aura of peace.

BookText.li: Life is all around you.
It is in the air you breath.
It is in the water you drink.
It is in the melodies you hear.
It is in the beauty you see.
It is in the sensations you feel.
It is all encompassing.
Do not isolate yourself.
Isolation is not the way of life.
Recognize your surroundings.
You are part of something greater.
Alone, yet never lonesome.
Let love for all guide you.
Mirror the warmth that you receive.
Let the wonders of life flow through you.
Inhalte life, and breathe it out.
Let it grow.

ThingDef.label: Calling of Druj
ThingDef.Description: A piece of literature that seems to be written in strange hyroglyphs, with some gibberish in High Gothic interspersed. It seems to radiate an aura of unease.

BookText.li: Ahrastab is calling.
Trust the feather in the red.
Glancing in shadows.
Cuts deep.
Cannot see, cannot unsee.
Voices in the back.
What lies beneath.
Always there, never existed.
Sow silence, harvest pain.
Recognize yourself.
Lost by being found.
Whispers in the dark.
Destroy by creating.
I am Druj.

ThingDef.label: Litany of Asumod
ThingDef.Description: A piece of literature that seems to be written in strange hyroglyphs, with some gibberish in High Gothic interspersed. It seems to radiate an aura of anger.

BookText.li: Blaaargh.
Flower in red.
Sweetly dripping.
Flowing freely.
Hatred rising.
Rivers in crimson.
Branches in white.
Harmonies in mist.
Calling, craving.
Cleansing by renewal.
Smoldering beneath.
Glow in the darkness.
Ripping and tearing.
